Parent.subject: What one issue should ‘We the People’ unite and solve first to make our country even better?
Parent.description:
This task is testing an application for large scale online discussion that is unbiased, thoughtful, doesn’t require reading millions of answers, and leads to awesome results.

We are only asking about a concern - an issue or problem, not about any possible solutions.

Think about it before answering, think outside the box, think big and think about everyone in the country uniting on this.

At the end, your feedback will be welcomed.

types.name: Profile
types.instruction: For this discussion we ask participants for demographic information to help us determine the diversity of the discussion.

buttonTitle.active: Engage with your community on this
buttonTitle.inactive: Promote this discussion within your community to get enough people to engaged in this discussion

types.name: User Registration
types.instruction:
You need a way to come back to this discussion, and we need to be able to notify you when there are more questions or input for you to consider. So this is where you can create an account tied to your email address.

Or, if you are really not ready to trust this yet, you can accept the terms and conditions and then click on the Skip this button.

types.name: This Deliberation Structure

unsorted.name: unsorted

title.active: Yea! this is in a stack
title.inactive: Put this in in a stack

unsorted.direction: Great! You have completed this step. You can review your choices or continue to the next step.

most.name: Most

title.inactive: Put this in Most important stack

most.direction: Please chose 3 things that are most important

least.name: Least

title.active: This is in the least important stack of them all
title.inactive: Put this in the least important stack of them all

least.direction: Please on item as least important

types.instruction: This civil deliberation structured into steps, as shown below. You can move back to a step by clicking on it. After some steps, there will be a pause while other participants complete the step.

types.name: Answer
types.instruction: You probably want to see what other people are saying first. But, "Wisdom of the Crowd" theory says that independent answers yield the best results in the end.  And, don't worry - everyone starts by first contributing their own, unbiased, independent answer.

types.name: Wait for the Group
types.instruction: You are ahead of the pack. At this point, we will wait for the others to gather. We will proceed to reviewing responses after the others have finished, or the timer has elapsed.

types.name: Sort Answers
types.instruction:
Of these issues please sort them in order of most, neutral, or least important for everyone to consider. 

Please choose 2 most important, and 1 least important.

types.name: Why it's Important
types.evaluateQuestion: Why should everyone consider solving this issue?
types.instruction: Of the issues you thought were most important, please give a brief explanation of why it's important for everyone to consider it

types.name: Why it's Least Important
types.evaluateQuestion: Why is this issue least important for the community to consider?
types.instruction: Of the issues you thought were least important to consider, please give a brief explanation of why

types.name: Wait for the Group
types.instruction: You are ahead of the pack. At this point, we will wait for the others to gather. We will proceed to reviewing responses after the others have finished, or the timer has elapsed.

types.name: Compare Reasons Why it's Important
types.instruction: Of these reasons others have given for why this issue is important, please choose the most convincing explanation

types.name: Compare Reasons Why it's Least Important
types.instruction: Of these reasons others have given for why this issue is least important, please choose the most convincing explanation

types.name: Wait for the Group
types.instruction: You are ahead of the pack. At this point, we will wait for the others to gather. We will proceed to reviewing responses after the others have finished, or the timer has elapsed.

types.name: Review
types.instruction:
These are the issues you sorted earlier, with reasons added by the discussion. 

Please consider the reasons and sort the list again. You can use the [Dissect] button to zoom in on the reasons for a particular issue.  Or you can just click on a the headline of a reason that you see. To return to the list, click on the [Disect] button again.

types.name: Wait for the Group
types.instruction: You are ahead of the pack. At this point, we will wait for the others to gather. We will proceed to reviewing responses after the others have finished, or the timer has elapsed.

choices.name: Sad
choices.title: I'm disappointed that the group landed on this, I wish that we had come to something better.

component.description: This is the issue with the most support with this discussion group.
component.evaluateQuestion: How do you feel about it?

types.name: Optional - How are we doing?
types.instruction:
We welcome your thoughts about how this works.  -- We have a few goals to achieve:

  1) Easy to use
2) Evoke meaningful and authentic input and discussion
 3) Create interactions that lead to solutions the whole country can believe in.

Any thoughts you have, positive or negative, that would help us achieve these goals are greatly appreciated.

types.name: Optional - criticism?
types.instruction: Can you tell us one thing that didn't work well, could be better, or that you just didn't like? Believe it or not, it's harder to get this kind of criticism type feedback than we thought, but that's what we want so we can keep improving things.
